Reading and Decoding AxF Representations

In order to support a wide range of rendering applications, the SDK offers different levels of access to the AxF representations with increasing flexibility and complexity:

  1. Browsing-Only
    Accessing only names of materials, representations and preview images in the AxF File, e.g. for browsing the contents of an AxF file. The corresponding C-style interface can be found in the namespace axf::decoding.
  2. CPU-Only Decoding and Sampling
    Decode AxF representations on the CPU using the BRDF-like interface axf::decoding::CPUDecoder. For rendering engines based on Monte-Carlo raytracing techniques there exists also the interface axf::decoding::Sampler which can be used to efficiently sample an AxF material. These interfaces can be used by CPU-based rendering engines which aim only for a basic integration of AxF materials. Nonetheless, since the SDK implementations are not aggressively optimized, they should be used primarily for reference and testing purposes. In particular, we do not recommend to use this way of decoding in performance critical production environments.
  3. 3rd-party Decoding and Sampling
    For applications which require or prefer to implement a custom decoding of AxF representations the SDK provides access to the representations resources, i.e. parameters, colors and textures. This functionality is provided by the interface axf::decoding::TextureDecoder. The following representations are currently available for defined texture retrieval:
    • SVBRDF Representation
    • Hybrid Model- and Image-based Carpaint Representation
    • Representations based on Matrix Factorization
    Please refer to the respective chapters for details on implementing a custom decoding of these representations.

Editing AxF Representations

Editing complex measured appearance data can be considered the next evolutionary step of digital appearance representations. Beyond basic decoding, editing requires a deeper understanding of the underlying physical effects and the mathematical models used to represent them. Editing of AxF representation is not part of the AxF Decoding SDK.
